These pages contains the material used for the course *Introduction to Data Science*, part of the [curriculum](https://www.gov.br/inpe/pt-br/area-conhecimento/posgraduacao/cap/catalogo-de-disciplinas) of the [Graduate Program in Applied Computing](https://www.gov.br/inpe/pt-br/area-conhecimento/posgraduacao/cap), offeredy by the [Brazilian National Institute for Space Research](https://www.gov.br/inpe/pt-br). 

The course is usually offered in the [second term](https://www.gov.br/inpe/pt-br/area-conhecimento/posgraduacao/calendario-academico) of each year, exclusively on-site. Albeit the material is in English, classes are usually taught in Portuguese.

## Syllabus

What is Data Science? Why Data Science exists as a discipline? 
The role of a Data Scientist. Other roles and tasks in Data Science. 
Data Collection and Discovery. Data Provenance and Annotation. 
Data Representation: Flat Files, Databases, Tidy Data.
Introduction to Analytics, Exploratory Data Analysis and Machine Learning.
Reproducible Research. Data-based products. 
Examples of applications, case studies and project development.

### Bibliography

For a good all-around reference in Data Science see _The Art of Data Science: A Guide for Anyone who works with Data_ [@peng2015art] or _Doing Data Science: Straight Talk from the Frontline_ [@doingdatascience2013].

For information on data scientists profiles see _Analyzing the Analyzers: An Introspective Survey of Data Scientists and Their Work_ [@analyzingtheanalyzers] or _Data scientists at work_ [@gutierrez2014data].
